intro: Nidularium acanthocrater, commonly known as the spiny hooded fern, is a unique member of the Polypodiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny, and often hairy fronds that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, including sori, are located on the undersides of its leaves. The botanical features of Nidularium acanthocrater make it an interesting subject for both ecological and horticultural study.
